intro: Solanum crassitomentosum, commonly known as the hairy nightshade, is a perennial shrub native to South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, potatoes, and peppers. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, and it produces small, yellowish flowers that develop into berries. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, shaded environments. Due to its toxic properties, it is not typically cultivated for agricultural purposes.
